positive.review:
+ Balanced game
+ Fun for very long time
+ Satisfaction from strategy setup
+ Almost everything is available for free

- While i can't say it is pay to win, but without paying for microtransaction game is 30% slower

Good game, even if you want to stay F2P it's worth checking out.
Keep in mind... It's not your casual idle game. It's worth more to keep it running in the background or your phone. This way you'll have better rewards and faster progress overall. 

How you play, is completely up to you.

A simple, satisfying tower defense game where leveling up quirky heroes and watching them shred waves of enemies feels great. It’s relaxing, colorful, and perfect for quick sessions or letting your team rack up progress while you kick back. A fun, feel-good idle TD with plenty of charm.

Balanced game, Fun for very long time
Almost everything is available for free

It's a pretty fun idle game. Lots of systems, lots of interactions, lots of progress to be had. You can be as active or as idle as you want, you can be as online or offline as you want, it's a smooth experience any-which-way.

There are things you can pay for, but obviously none are necessary (they just move you along the infinite progression "faster").

Had to scratch my head when I read this was a solo dev project. The game is extremely polished and the most important part is that its a lot of fun. Its honestly the first game where I looked at the cash shop and wasn't even upset. The dev deserves a little support just by putting this game out for free and buying a couple microtransactions seems very worth it. 

The free to play portion seems on point. You can so far by a ton of things just by playing and game. Only thing I wished for was maybe a x3 speed at the start instead of x2 even though in a couple weeks I plan to buy the x6 max speed just for support. 

If you like TD games give this a shot its pretty dam awesome + you can gain while offline.
great little idle game, not forced to buy in app purchases but plenty of great deals if you want to support the devs for this free idle game with plenty of updates since ive started playing
I left this open on accident and everything still fought and progressed good. Cool effects and skill ideas. Cool design for characters.

Well it was fun until the new version came out and caused me to start over. I am also unable to sign in. It opens up the browser page and you go through the whole thing and it just says Done but never actually signs you in. Tried several browsers and no go on any of them.  I did like the concept though.
EDIT : After several more attempts at logging in I was able to get logged in. So no more losing my account. Sorry for being so frustrating at the time of writing that review I was also dealing with an Karen and so i guess I became a Karen my self. I apologize for that. Any way I am playing the game again and have almost 40 hours on it and I managed to get back to where I was and now I can log in. I guess it took switching from fire dragon to Brave to get the log in to work. As I tried fire dragan, vivaldi and firefox but the only one that worked seemed to be brave. Although I have had problems with firedragon before and the guys over at garuda linux have found solutions not sure what the solution would be for not being able to log in with it though. Any way the game is working now.
Caught me for many hours. Daily, weekly and monthly missions.
Banned for sped up the game using CE, the game prevent me to use rank feature XD

I'm actually having a blast with this one! It's one of the few actually meaningful decent Idle games out here. It was such a great idea to blend an idle game with a tower defense game. I hope games do this. The only reason I don't have hardly any hours on steam for this game is cuz I downloaded it on Android because it seems like the perfect mobile game to play on the go or laying down at home.
Pretty nice so far
Fun little Idler, if you just need something relaxing to waste time with. :)
addicting
can play at your own pace.
Pretty good tower defense
good time killer
pretty elaborate tower defense
a fun lil idle TD game
fun if you ignore the pay to progress
It's fun as hell!
Fun game atm
Good game
Good game
good game
Very nice.
not bad
ok

My gambling addict friend said if I post a review and it gets 150 likes and 50 Awards that he will buy me a case of beer, some vodka and 1 kg of lemon So im just gonna leave this here.

Мой друг-игроман сказал, что если я опубликую отзыв и он наберет 150 лайков и 50 наград, он купит мне ящик пива, немного водки и 1 кг лимона, так что я просто оставлю это здесь.

This is a really cute game with more subsystems than most TD games. There's almost always an exclamation point somewhere telling you that you can advance a bit and get that happy brain chemical drip.

On the downside, the pay-to-win philosophy is deep and intrusive, with near constant reminders that your life would be easier if only you gave them your money. Many of those exclamation points either announce an opportunity to pay or include one along with the regular progress. It's not so intrusive I've stopped playing, but if this is the sort of thing that bothers you, this is the sort of game that will bother you.

Game is free.  And it's fine.  It's also free - but it reeeally wants your money.  Your acceleration could be so much faster if you just microtransact once.  Or twice.  You don't have to, of course - because it's free - but think of all the fun you COULD be having if you microtransact.

It hits all the major points and complexities of a good tower defense. Boards are designed to be played actively or idle.  If you've played these games before, you'll enjoy it.  But you'll enjoy it more and FASTER if you open your wallet.
mid mid mid TD game only fun if u play like 1-2 times a day to check in, shits just a cash grab, like 30cad+ for 1 side of a battlepass

+ Balanced game
+ Fun for very long time
+ Satisfaction from strategy setup
+ Almost everything is available for free

- While i can't say it is pay to win, but without paying for microtransaction game is 30% slower

Good game, even if you want to stay F2P it's worth checking out.
Keep in mind... It's not your casual idle game. It's worth more to keep it running in the background or your phone. This way you'll have better rewards and faster progress overall. 

How you play, is completely up to you.

Never ending tower defense.  So far enjoying having it on in the background while working.  There is not much to do if you want to be "active" but its a great idler.  Looking forward to seeing whats next.

A simple, satisfying tower defense game where leveling up quirky heroes and watching them shred waves of enemies feels great. It’s relaxing, colorful, and perfect for quick sessions or letting your team rack up progress while you kick back. A fun, feel-good idle TD with plenty of charm.

Balanced game, Fun for very long time
Almost everything is available for free.

Really good idle TD game. plenty to do, easy to learn, but hard to master. Really fun so far. 

Thumbs up from me

Fun semi-idle game. You can let it idle to a certain point, depending on what your goal is. Lot of things to upgrade. You can buy your way to the top, or play and earn it over time which is more fun to play the game IMO.
Annoying is when there is a large update I have to uninstall and reinstall it as steam doesn't seem to just update it for some reason.
Latest update adds automation ability which is expensive, but increases the Idle ability of the game which is great.

It's a pretty fun idle game. Lots of systems, lots of interactions, lots of progress to be had. You can be as active or as idle as you want, you can be as online or offline as you want, it's a smooth experience any-which-way.

There are things you can pay for, but obviously none are necessary (they just move you along the infinite progression "faster").

ended up enjoying this game way more then i thought its fun having goal to go for. once you get boss rush and automation game becomes a cake walk

i can understand the reviews not enjoying the game it does take some time to get to where your able to let the game auto prestige and progress without being on. but its worth it really don't take that long if you go by the help people give in the discord that will make it a whole lot funnier and faster to get to certain points of the game, without discord i was getting bored to but once i joined and started going by the guides it became way funnier.
it really is just an idle tower dfenses game that runs on run screen while i do work or another game.
great little idle game, not forced to buy in app purchases but plenty of great deals if you want to support the devs for this free idle game with plenty of updates since ive started playing
I left this open on accident and everything still fought and progressed good. Cool effects and skill ideas. Cool design for characters.

Well it was fun until the new version came out and caused me to start over. I am also unable to sign in. It opens up the browser page and you go through the whole thing and it just says Done but never actually signs you in. Tried several browsers and no go on any of them.  I did like the concept though.
EDIT : After several more attempts at logging in I was able to get logged in. So no more losing my account. Sorry for being so frustrating at the time of writing that review I was also dealing with an Karen and so i guess I became a Karen my self. I apologize for that. Any way I am playing the game again and have almost 40 hours on it and I managed to get back to where I was and now I can log in. I guess it took switching from fire dragon to Brave to get the log in to work. As I tried fire dragan, vivaldi and firefox but the only one that worked seemed to be brave. Although I have had problems with firedragon before and the guys over at garuda linux have found solutions not sure what the solution would be for not being able to log in with it though. Any way the game is working now.

Why do I have over 4,000+ hours in this game?

...because it is an active/idle game you can run in the background of your computer. 

Why do I play it?

...because it scratches the itch of building towards goals through incremental progress while at the same time NOT wasting my time with advertising to speed up progression.  

If you are an idle / tower defense type of gamer, this is a no-brainer for you!

A surprisingly engaging tower defense game with a satisfying sense of progression. Upgrading heroes and strategically placing them is key to overcoming challenges. Fun to pick up for short bursts or longer play sessions.
Good game for people that like to spend crazy amounts of times in a game 10/10

All the good things about an idle clicker merged into a tower defense. Lots of pathways to upgrade too. You might think only 10 spots for "towers" is too few, but your combination options between the towers, synergies, and upgrade builds leaves a lot of room for replay value which the user experiences during prestige advancements (or restarting with currency for upgrades).
Pretty good. Play for free or spend your way to the top. Works either way.
Typical TD Idle game. Exactly what I was looking for and addicting to play. I had to even make my husband download it as he kept taking over mine ha. Love this genre of games for a wind down.
a different type of tower defense game for me. The idle mechanism is quite enjoyable.
Caught me for many hours. Daily, weekly and monthly missions.
Best Idle game available between PC & Mobile.

Had to scratch my head when I read this was a solo dev project. The game is extremely polished and the most important part is that its a lot of fun. Its honestly the first game where I looked at the cash shop and wasn't even upset. The dev deserves a little support just by putting this game out for free and buying a couple microtransactions seems very worth it. 

The free to play portion seems on point. You can so far by a ton of things just by playing and game. Only thing I wished for was maybe a x3 speed at the start instead of x2 even though in a couple weeks I plan to buy the x6 max speed just for support. 

If you like TD games give this a shot its pretty dam awesome + you can gain while offline.
Banned for sped up the game using CE, the game prevent me to use rank feature XD

I'm actually having a blast with this one! It's one of the few actually meaningful decent Idle games out here. It was such a great idea to blend an idle game with a tower defense game. I hope games do this. The only reason I don't have hardly any hours on steam for this game is cuz I downloaded it on Android because it seems like the perfect mobile game to play on the go or laying down at home.

4/10. I don't want to give a red flag just because the game is free. I would pay 3-5 bux, no more. Unfortunately, in-game purchases are ridiculously high. No way Im paying ten bucks for a game like that, not mentioning  a single partial improvement. All negative reviews make sense. I have 3 hours on a counter, and the game is already slow. Soon it will be boring. The idle part is ok however.
Fun, engaging, and just complicated enough to keep things interesting.
Its a nice relaxing game with straigthforward gameplay.

Cool tower defense game,
Easy to learn system.
Recommend everyone get it,
Its fun, 
and its a free download on steam.
So much fun stuff to do and not hard to learn, if you have questions the community is really helpful to get you started. Even the prices to get a boost in your gameplay is really good
its an ok game for a gotcha. the Microtransactions are a bit excessive / expensive.

Really awesome idler, it quickly became my second idle game. Lots of new contents beeing added to the game.
Cross platform, you can play with the same account on mobile aswell.

Endless idle tower defense game full of deep strategy and combat mechanics. Unlock and upgrade dozens of epic fantasy heroes to defeat an infinite swarm of enemy monsters. Strategize hero positions, synergies, and skills for an effective defense, then sit back and let the auto-battler do its thing!
pretty enjoyable, always progressing and easy to understand
very fun, so many to do/grind, easy to learn hard to master
Addictive and strategic yum!
Great game and so good at beating boredom
Hyper addictive. Loving it so far.
Pretty good for an idler.
solid idle game, solid td
Pretty nice so far
Fun little Idler, if you just need something relaxing to waste time with. :)
all I can say is loving it so far
Its a simple Time waste game
fun time consumer
Quite fun. Try it.
Nice Time-waster
GG , really like it
fun idle game
addicting
good
Far as a an Idle game goes, it's pretty decent.
Nice game, tere is a lot of grinding to do =)
Good game
good

it ok
fun
Fun
can play at your own pace.
Good to kill time.
i like it
Fun and devs are good
really fun

negative.review: This game hits just about every square in predatory microtransaction bingo. Would not recommend.

One of those simple game that wants you to spend $1000 per week to advance 1 level
No substance, just souless money grabbing
Cash grab with a intrusive pay to win. Defies the whole point of idle if you can just pay your way to progress. Ruins the fun and a constant reminder of the pointlessness.

It didn’t take long before the old FOMO “starter pack” popped up for £9.99. It’s the usual pay to win spam constant nags to buy something every ten minutes. My total playtime got me to the second round of FOMO-bait nonsense.

This is one of the most pay to win games I've seen in a while.  You are literally purchasing the ability to compete with other players.  There is no subtlety and the screen is littered with ways to spend real life cash.  As far as the game itself, it runs without bugs and there are a lot of buttons to press to level this and that.  A key issue is that the hero/tower progression is busted.  You waste time buying heroes to have to replace them the next day.  The earlier heroes are mostly useless at this point.  I could deal with this if it wasn't for the crazy ads everywhere, trying to fish for whales.  Sometimes with a free game, you are the commodity.
This game hits just about every square in predatory microtransaction bingo. Would not recommend.
The primary game loop is: prestige, buy upgrades, come back later, buy upgrades, come back later, prestige, repeat. Over and over again. Nothing more to it. It's boring.

One of those simple game that wants you to spend $1000 per week to advance 1 level
No substance, just souless money grabbing
Cash grab with a intrusive pay to win. Defies the whole point of idle if you can just pay your way to progress. Ruins the fun and a constant reminder of the pointlessness.

The progress is needlessly slow, and very repetitive.   You prestige and upgrade, but may not even get to a further wave your next run.  Prestige 10 times, and you may go 5 waves further on your next run.  All of this would be fine, if this was actually an idle game...but it is not.

It didn’t take long before the old FOMO “starter pack” popped up for £9.99. It’s the usual pay to win spam constant nags to buy something every ten minutes. My total playtime got me to the second round of FOMO-bait nonsense.

Pay2Win :/
Mobile style.
Not fun, not worth the time or currency.
fun enough game, insane monetization.

Very boring and slow, pretty much just prestige constantly to get slightly farther (maybe a wave or two). Would be great if there was noticeable progression possible after wave 250. If this gets updated I'll come back as it has potential, but right now it's not fun to play.
Vikings are not black.

A key issue is that the hero/tower progression is busted.  You waste time buying heroes to have to replace them the next day.  The earlier heroes are mostly useless at this point.  I could deal with this if it wasn't for the crazy ads everywhere, trying to fish for whales.  Sometimes with a free game, you are the commodity.

This is one of the most pay to win games I've seen in a while.  You are literally purchasing the ability to compete with other players.  There is no subtlety and the screen is littered with ways to spend real life cash.  As far as the game itself, it runs without bugs and there are a lot of buttons to press to level this and that.  A key issue is that the hero/tower progression is busted.  You waste time buying heroes to have to replace them the next day.  The earlier heroes are mostly useless at this point.  I could deal with this if it wasn't for the crazy ads everywhere, trying to fish for whales.  Sometimes with a free game, you are the commodity.
This game hits just about every square in predatory microtransaction bingo. Would not recommend.
The primary game loop is: prestige, buy upgrades, come back later, buy upgrades, come back later, prestige, repeat. Over and over again. Nothing more to it. It's boring.

One of those simple game that wants you to spend $1000 per week to advance 1 level
No substance, just souless money grabbing
Cash grab with a intrusive pay to win. Defies the whole point of idle if you can just pay your way to progress. Ruins the fun and a constant reminder of the pointlessness.

The progress is needlessly slow, and very repetitive.   You prestige and upgrade, but may not even get to a further wave your next run.  Prestige 10 times, and you may go 5 waves further on your next run.  All of this would be fine, if this was actually an idle game...but it is not.

It didn’t take long before the old FOMO “starter pack” popped up for £9.99. It’s the usual pay to win spam constant nags to buy something every ten minutes. My total playtime got me to the second round of FOMO-bait nonsense.

Pay2Win :/
Mobile style.
Not fun, not worth the time or currency.
